description: Borrowed from Spanish camarilla, from cámara (“chamber”) and the diminutive suffix -illa.

entries.meaning: A secret, usually sinister, group of conspiring advisors close to the leadership; a cabal.
examples: The same lack of accountability has been even more disastrous for the two state-owned banks, which exist primarily to funnel IMF and World Bank funds to the president and his camarilla in the form of unsecured loans.
